page.title: 02Farming in the Codford Area
page.content: The biggest industry in the locality of Codford School is agriculture. The Down landscape in the wylye valley allows high production of milk, beef and sheep meat. The odd pig unit can be observed.Cereals which are grown in large acreages are wheat and barley in the main, with oil seed rape for animal feed, feed peas and beans again for animals. A small acreage of potatoes for human consumption. The soil along the edge of the river Wylye is good for growing lush grass for dairy cows,whilst further away from the river and onto the Downs it becomes chalk land with a shallow tilth this being extensively used for growing the cereals. The poorer parts of the Down land have a permanant grass ley to rear sheep on.
